@guille9815 You can reach me through Twitter, LinkedIn or https://t.co/khKMspkz2N BUT best to get a referral.  #StanfordTEChat
If you have technical insight & want to start a company, call me-I will help + be your first investor. #StanfordTEChat
.@yonidayan_ Thank you everyone.  #StanfordTEChat
.@guille9815 Entrepreneur must be "renaissance man(person)". They must be intelligent, hard working, flexible, persevere... #StanfordTEChat
.@carribeiro Age, Background, Education, Location none are deterministic. They are correlated, but can be overcome.  #StanfordTEChat
.@RoshniPKumar Hewlet and Packard. Page and Brin. Vinod and Scott. I can go on and on on founders who have degrees! #StanfordTEChat
.@dhrupal93 Both. And learning about the market/competitors. And raising money. No one said entrepreneurship is easy. #StanfordTEChat
.@RoshniPKumar True Steve Jobs dropped out, but most don't. I am a big fan of education. #StanfordTEChat
.@krital Never a bubble (or a depression) for a great team + real technical insight. Great companies start in all markets. #StanfordTEChat
.@smendozab Empathy. Root of developing many other skills. #StanfordTEChat
.@allentom NDA's good. Non-compete are bad. Thankfully non-compete not allwd in CA. Look what they did to Boston VC! #StanfordTEChat
.@RoshniPKumar If large enough, sure. #StanfordTEChat
.@irenezanoria I don't. My entrepreneurs do.I just try to support them as much as possible knowing it's inevitable (& hard!) #StanfordTEChat
.@dhrupal93 Happens all the time. Rmembr the Basic compiler company called Microsoft? Or, the DVD shipping company Netflix? #StanfordTEChat
.@irenezanoria Many (most?) angels invest for entertainment. All VCs do it (or should!) professionally to make returns. #StanfordTEChat
.@irenezanoria Completely different. I am a professional investor, who happens to be focused earlier than traditional VC. #StanfordTEChat
.@StanfordE145_TE   I feel differently. No one said Steve Jobs was nice to work with. Or, Bill Gates. Or Larry Ellison. #StanfordTEChat
.@zeeshansulahria You can't. But great investors can tell. #StanfordTEChat
.@guille9815 Was it Steve Jobs or the PC, iPod, Pixar, iPhone... :-)  #StanfordTEChat
.@allentom RedFlags: (a) > 4 years since last fund was raised. (b) Investor on too many boards (c) no discernable strategy. #StanfordTEChat
.@yonidayan_ Call previous CEO's and ask! You'll be surprised what entrepreneurs say after an investor is off their Board:-) #StanfordTEChat
.@StanfordE145_TE Ask investor how many of their founders came back and took money *again* for their next startup. #StanfordTEChat
.@smendozab Core tech is not being commoditized. In fact many other businesses are being commoditized by tech. #StanfordTEChat
.@qwetrsd  Find a path to making money (profits). Background/role doesn't matter. Great entrepreneurs can come from anywhere #StanfordTEChat
.@zeeshansulahria Diff. investors prefer diff. points on the risk/reward curve. Find an investor aligned w/ your goals. #StanfordTEChat
.@blacksoftware Best advice I heard was from my mentor Kathryn Gould on discrimination: "Be oblivious".  #StanfordTEChat
.@spikelab  Its about direction, not traction. Investor has to believe the trajectory is up. Remember Myspace? #StanfordTEChat
.@AlimamodM Hard Work. Harder work. And even Harder work. All the successful and most "lucky" ppl I know work really hard. #StanfordTEChat
.@krital VC is the most expensive money you will raise. Delay/Reduce as much as possible. (Yes, I am a VC :-) #StanfordTEChat
.@spikelab Great investors can see the opportunity before traction makes it obvious. #StanfordTEChat
.@vikonline To quote Moritz "The laws of gravity have not been repealed". You must have a path to making profits. #StanfordTEChat
.@feoornik Great company starting business plans cannot be stolen. Notice business plan<>idea (bplan=team+idea+etc.) #StanfordTEChat
.@brunowinck Great companies are *always* evolving the team. Sheryl did not start FB. Omid did not start Google etc. #StanfordTEChat
@guille9815 Valuation rule: "I will give you any valuation you want if you let me name the terms". Many unicorns not $1b! #StanfordTEChat
.@smendozab Investing is a package deal. No single factor. Different investors will see the "package" differently.  #StanfordTEChat
@guille9815 Valuation is what someone will pay. BUT valuation <> number. Watch strings (terms) that come with valuation! #StanfordTEChat
.@brunowinck Agreed. But they had a path to all four.  #StanfordTEChat
.@dhrupal93 Market size for VC is best done bottoms up: Number of customers x $/customer - (cost). Ignore top-down size! #StanfordTEChat
.@mmtmatthew Golden rule of VC: Great Team + Large Market + High barrier to entry + Compelling financials. #StanfordTEChat
.@adilmuhammad Luck + Frustration at SGI. Went on sabbatical and ran into a gr8 oppty - started my first company with $10K #StanfordTEChat
6/Am interested in discussing technical entrepreneurship, software technologies and VC in the silicon valley eco-system #StanfordTEChat
